descripcion:
Cubicles .com provides office furniture and related services to corporate America. With decades of experience and resources we service commercial office and home office buyers across the USA.
To qualify for this position, you must possess excellent English language skills - verbal and written. Please submit your expression of interest including your CV in English.
Duties & Responsibilities Office Space Planner (100% Remote)
As an office space planner, you'll work closely with our USA sales & design team . Your focus will center around interpreting and producing effective office furniture design layout. Your designs will help create meaningful client engagements. Daily tasks are typically under tight deadlines , so a natural sense of urgency is necessary to succeed
This role primarily consists of space planning for commercial office environments. Specifically, creating 2D plans with unified design solutions for the placement of office furniture (cubicles, desks, reception, conference, seating, etc.) within the parameters of a building‚Äôs existing walls, columns, windows, HVAC, etc.
Your designs will thoughtfully consider customer preferences, organizational workflows and building codes. You may at times create 3D renderings to help complete a winning bid package, but it won‚Äôt be the primary focus of your work. Our office furniture product is modular and/or comprised of multiple components, hence a math-oriented technical mind that enjoys ‚Äúfitting together all the puzzle pieces‚Äù is necessary to succeed.
You‚Äôll work with various types of customer-provided plans. Sometimes they‚Äôll be professionally created CAD/DWG files from a building contractor or architect. Sometimes they‚Äôll be hand sketches that you‚Äôll need to transcribe into our architectural software. Sometimes they‚Äôll be fully developed plan with existing interior elements (nonstructural walls, doors, hallways, etc.) and sometimes it will be a raw open space where you‚Äôll need to define these elements.
Employment Classification
Your engagement will be with a USA based company, governed by a general labor contract that will be performance/time based and defined by mutual agreement.
Please tell us about your ability to meet the following requirements in a brief cover letter as your expression of interest in this position:
LANGUAGE - Are you proficient in American English? Are you stronger verbally or in writing?
WORK TYPE - This role is full time and permanent/long term. Is this consistent with your objectives?
SCHEDULE ‚Äì Our office is headquartered in the USA (GMT -5) and is open for business Mon-Fri 8AM-6PM (EST/GMT-5). We expect all remote team members, regardless of personal time zone, to be able to work during most or all these hours.
REMOTE CULTURE ‚Äì We‚Äôre very face to face: we like to stay connected to each other by webcam and microphone in our online meeting spaces. Your virtual presence is essential for effective team collaboration and is a requirement of the position. Please tell us if you‚Äôre camera shy and/or how you feel about seeing & being seen on camera during working hours.
INTERNET ACCESS ‚Äì A high speed/broadband internet connection is crucial for this work. Working remotely means connecting to our US located computers and staying connected in our virtual office throughout the day.
SKILLSET ‚Äì This work demands a high degree of architectural/CAD proficiency. Please tell us about your CAD experience. Did you learn CAD in school? Have you worked with it professionally? Do you have any other skills or experience that you think might set you apart from other applicants?

Our client, a major oil and gas organization's Upstream division, is seeking a highly experienced and strategic Senior UX Designer to join their innovative UX design team. This role is pivotal in defining and driving research-based solutions to tackle the most complex technical challenges inherent in the Oil & Gas industry.
You will act as a design leader, working closely with cross-functional leadership, including principal engineers and senior project managers, to create elegant, scalable, and effective user interfaces that simplify highly complex tools and processes.
As a member of this highly collaborative team, you'll be responsible for the strategic direction of design solutions that significantly enhance enterprise-level productivity and help shape critical energy-related decisions globally. This is an exciting opportunity to leverage your deep industry experience while mentoring others and making a global, strategic impact.
What You'll Be Doing: Top 5 Responsibilities
Design Strategic Solutions: Your primary role is to define and lead the design of interfaces and processes that optimize user productivity across the enterprise, ensuring solutions are scalable and address complex systems-level challenges.
Integrate & Drive Research Strategy: Take ownership of integrating and translating insights from UX research into actionable design strategies, ensuring the final product is user-centered, evidence-based, and strategically sound.
Create & Govern Design Artifacts: Produce and guide the development of high-fidelity design artifacts (wireframes, prototypes, and design systems), ensuring design consistency and clarity across multiple product lines.
Lead Cross-Functional Collaboration: Serve as a senior design liaison, collaborating effectively with executive stakeholders, development leadership, and peer designers, and influencing long-term product roadmaps.
Champion Design Excellence: Beyond execution, you will actively educate, mentor, and advocate for the adoption of sound design principles and best practices across the organization.
What You'll Bring: Required Skills & Experience
üõ†Ô∏è Technical Expertise (10+ Years Experience Required)
UX Design Mastery: 10+ years of professional experience in designing complex user interfaces for enterprise-level web apps and desktop applications, with a proven history of solving highly technical, domain-specific problems.
Prototyping & System Design: Expert proficiency in design and prototyping tools (e.g., Figma, Sketch) and significant experience building, maintaining, and governing Design Systems.
Agile Leadership: Extensive experience and leadership working within Agile or Lean software development teams, comfortable setting design direction in fast-paced, iterative environments.
Complex Systems Design: Deep, demonstrated experience designing for expert systems, real-time data visualization, or control systems within high-stakes, technical domains (e.g., energy, finance, aerospace).
Collaboration & Tooling: Expert command of collaboration and project management tools (e.g., Jira, Confluence, Miro) to manage and communicate design scope and priorities effectively.
üë• Soft Skills & Mindset
Collaboration and Team Leadership: Proven ability to lead and mentor design team members, driving consensus, and fostering productive collaboration across diverse, senior-level teams.
Strategic Influence: Exceptional ability to communicate, present, and influence senior stakeholders and engineering leadership on the value and direction of UX strategy.
Flexibility and Adaptability: Experience managing multiple complex projects and adapting design strategy in response to evolving business priorities and technical constraints.
Industry & Technical Curiosity: A deep passion for continuous learning and an ability to quickly immerse in highly technical, domain-specific knowledge to drive innovation.
Visionary Problem-Solving: The critical ability to anticipate future user needs and define creative, user-centered solutions that address systemic, enterprise-level technical challenges.
Candidate Profile & Details
Experience Level: Senior-level with 10+ years of professional UX design experience, specifically in designing and leading strategy for complex, expert-driven products.
Educational Background: Required: Bachelor's degree in Design, Human Factors, HCI, Information Science, or a similar field. Preferred: A Master‚Äôs or advanced degree is highly beneficial.
Industry Background (Highly Preferred): Deep experience in designing for technical, expert systems or real-time data systems in complex technical domains (e.g., energy, software, specialized industries).
Team Environment: You will be a key contributor and leader in a highly collaborative team of designers, researchers, scientists, and engineers dedicated to improving tools and processes that support multi-million-dollar decisions.
